org.jetel.util

Class TaskQueueManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.TaskQueueManager

  • public class TaskQueueManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A bounded container that is capable of load balancing tasks among a (limited) number of TaskQueue-s (limit means number of simultaneously running tasks... there is also a limit on the number of tasks in single queue - see maxQueueLength)
    Since:
    2008-12-01

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_CONCURRENT_LIMIT 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskQueueManager() 
      TaskQueueManager(int concurrentLimit) 
      TaskQueueManager(int concurrentLimit, int maxQueueLength) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
      Schedules a task Either in new queue (if pool size is less than maximum) or in some existing queue if pool reached its maximum
      void finish()
      finish all tasks in all queues and wait for it This method blocks until all tasks in all queues are executed As a result all queues are marked as dead No need to worry though, because subsequent call to addTask() will start new queues silently
      int getConcurrentLimit() 
      boolean isVerbose() 
      void setConcurrentLimit(int concurrentLimit) 
      void setVerbose(boolean verbose) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • addTask

        public boolean addTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Schedules a task Either in new queue (if pool size is less than maximum) or in some existing queue if pool reached its maximum
        Parameters:
        task -
        Returns:
        Returns true if task has been successfully scheduled or false if it has been ignored

      • finish

        public void finish()
        finish all tasks in all queues and wait for it This method blocks until all tasks in all queues are executed As a result all queues are marked as dead No need to worry though, because subsequent call to addTask() will start new queues silently

        public int getConcurrentLimit()
